results.title: Wolfe and Montcalm
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film recreates the tense hours before the Battle of the Plains of Abraham (1759, Quebec), and then the battle itself in which both Generals Wolfe and Montcalm were fatally wounded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Wargon, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: What is the big complaint?
results.creator_credit: Salvatore Greco and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The difficulty in dialogue when a traveller from Ontario knowing very little French, must ask directions, becomes the core of a pleasant little episode in Quebec. Included are several men on the street’s views about the situation in Quebec.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Salvatore Greco and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Nature of healing
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: This 6 part series draws upon the combined knowledge of Eastern and Western medicine, and reveals techniques and therapies to achieve true health and harmony. It will change the way life and health is perceived.

results.title: Biomagnetism
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
This program looks at magnetic field therapy, an approach much researched, particularly in Japan. Biomagnetic therapy combined with drug therapy has been used to successfully treat depression, dementia, non-healing fractures and spinal injuries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV

results.title: Homeopathy
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Homoeopathy is a complementary medicine which is gradually gaining acceptance within traditional medicine. It is a therapy with a holistic approach, treating the causes rather than the symptoms of illness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV

results.title: These things I still question
results.creator_credit: Ken Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ken Saunders questions the things in his life that he didn’t understand, like why his dad was treated differently, why he couldn’t play with the white kids and why people just let this happen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Touch
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Massage and touch therapies are commonly used to alleviate stress with steam baths together with massage a common therapy used in Japan and Hawaii. Aromatherapy, meditation, acupressure and reflexology are often combined to give holistic treatment to stress sufferers.

results.title: Country is my life
results.creator_credit: John Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Johnnie Lovett endeavours to express his love for country music, how it feeds his spirit and the people who have inspired and encouraged him to become a musician in the first place.

results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
The emphasis of acupuncture is on prevention rather than cure. First documented in ancient Chinese texts, acupuncture can be combined with other therapies to alleviate pain and is often used instead of anaesthesia. Cupping and acupressure use acupuncture techniques without the insertion of needles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV

Cupping and acupressure use acupuncture techniques without the insertion of needles.
